function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential increase in stress, depression, and anxiety due to social distancing and quarantine measures.","Impact":"Negatively impacts mental health and well-being of individuals.","Mitigation":"Provide access to mental health resources and support services, promote social connection through virtual means, and offer coping strategies for managing stress and anxiety.","Technologies":"Telehealth platforms for virtual therapy and counseling, mental health apps for self-care and stress management, online support groups and communities for social connection.","People":"General population, individuals in quarantine, those practicing social distancing.","Owner":"Healthcare providers, mental health professionals, public health organizations, and community leaders."},{"Description":"Potential lack of access to mental health resources and support services for individuals affected by quarantine and social distancing measures.","Impact":"Limited access to essential mental health care, exacerbation of mental health conditions, and increased distress.","Mitigation":"Develop and promote telehealth services, increase awareness of virtual mental health resources, and provide funding for accessible mental health support.","Technologies":"Telehealth platforms, mental health apps, online therapy services, and virtual support networks.","People":"Individuals in quarantine, those practicing social distancing, and vulnerable populations.","Owner":"Healthcare providers, mental health organizations, government agencies, and non-profit organizations."},{"Description":"Risk of misinformation and negative effects on mental health from excessive exposure to COVID-19 related news and media.","Impact":"Increased anxiety, fear, and stress due to misinformation, sensationalized news, and negative narratives.","Mitigation":"Promote accurate and reliable information, encourage media literacy and critical thinking, and limit exposure to distressing news and social media.","Technologies":"Media literacy resources, fact-checking websites, mental health apps for anxiety management, and online support groups for reliable information sharing.","People":"General population, individuals in quarantine, those practicing social distancing.","Owner":"Public health organizations, mental health advocates, media outlets, and educational institutions."}]}
